p: The horizontal and participatory nature of V&As also facilitates climate change cooperation across sectors. Involvement of professionals from water, energy, conservation, transportation, urban planning, agriculture, coastal management and related sectors provides information about health risks associated with key drivers from impacts or adaptation actions in these sectors [ 26]. This collaboration opens door to identifying adaptation and risk management responses across sectors that are often preventative in nature, more effective, cost less to society and maximize health co-benefits.
